page.title: 18A Child's Life in Ponsanooth
page.content: Although the school is outside the area it is very important in the life of the village as most of the events are connected with it. There are 64 children in the school who go on to Penryn Comprehensive school when they leave at eleven. There are two playgroups run by mothers which meet at various places. The children have to make their own amusements most of the time although there are some after school activities such as sailing club, guitar lessons and sports. This year the school organized three trips to do with a maritime project, one group sailing on a schooner and two youth hostelling for four days. We think that Ponsanooth will expand as more firms move in and we have noticed the increase in noise, traffic and people.
